titleStmt.title: A true character of sundry trades and callings: or, A new ditty of innocent mirth. This song is new, and perfect true, there's none can this deny; for I am known, friend, to be one that scorns to tell a lye. To the tune of, Old Simon the King. This may be printed, R.P.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for P[hilip]. Brooksby, at the Golden-Ball in Pye-corner.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Now gentlemen sit you all merry ..."
Place, date of publication and publisher's name from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
